definition: to reveal outstanding talent (idiom); to stand out as conspicuously brilliant
high/very
variant of 嶄|崭[chan2]
precipitous
variant of 嶄|崭[zhan3]
to show/to reveal/to betray/to expose
dew/syrup/nectar/outdoors (not under cover)/to show/to reveal/to betray/to expose
surname Lu
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
surname Jue
role (theater)/to compete/ancient three legged wine vessel/third note of pentatonic scale
angle/corner/horn/horn-shaped/unit of money equal to 0.1 yuan, or 10 cents (a dime)/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: As more time passes real world problems begin to surface.
sentences.chinese: 时间继续无声无息得流过，现实问题开始崭露头角。

sentences.english: Do you have any advice for up-and-coming programmers?
sentences.chinese: 您有什么忠告给崭露头角的程序员？

sentences.english: At the beginning of sixty time cut a striking figure painting, after study at the Xi'an Academy of Fine Arts.
sentences.chinese: 六十年代初在画坛崭露头角，后深造于西安美术学院。

sentences.english: GANI MARBLE TILES will take it as a important step to perform on the world stage.
sentences.chinese: 简一大理石瓷砖在世界舞台上崭露头角。

sentences.english: Buds, looking urgent, those on the conker trees already beginning to burst.
sentences.chinese: 树芽看上去很着急，七叶树上的芽儿已经崭露头角。

sentences.english: Young conductors earn their spurs in a small orchestra or opera house.
sentences.chinese: 年轻的指挥家们在小乐队或小歌剧院里崭露头角。

sentences.english: Thereinto, the grass-roots voluntary organizations have begun the fore.
sentences.chinese: 其中，草根志愿组织也已开始崭露头角。

sentences.english: Song Rong - hui is the early part of the last two years - and - coming female players.
sentences.chinese: 宋容慧初段是近两年崭露头角的女棋手。

sentences.english: This next big shift is on the horizon, but you can see it coming.
sentences.chinese: 新的变革还远在天边，但是你已经看到它崭露头角了。

sentences.english: Alison has made her mark in the theatre and is already playing leading parts.
sentences.chinese: 艾利森已在该剧院崭露头角，她已扮演主角。

sentences.english: He distinguished himself in British theatre at an early age.
sentences.chinese: 他很小就在英国戏剧界崭露头角了。

sentences.english: And Costner's machines finally got a look.
sentences.chinese: 科斯特纳的机器也终于得到了崭露头角的机会。

definition: lit. to first show one's horns (idiom); fig. a first show of emerging talent/first sign of emerging talent/budding genius
first sign of budding talent/to display one's ability for the first time
to stand firmly/to gain a foothold/to establish oneself
to emerge as a new force to be reckoned with (idiom)
to win instant success (idiom)/to become an instant hit
to shine (of talents, skills, accomplishment)/to demonstrate extraordinary talent or skill
to amaze the world with a single brilliant feat (idiom); an overnight celebrity
to rise to fame
to make one's name/to become famous
an up-and-coming youngster/new talent/a brilliant younger generation
lit. like the sun at noon (idiom)/fig. to be at the peak of one's power, career etc
to reveal one's talent (idiom)/to rise above others/to distinguish oneself

to come first in triennial palace examinations (idiom, refers to the carved stone turtle head in front of the imperial palace, next to which the most successful candidate in the imperial examinations was entitled to stand)/to be the champion/to be the very best in any field
to assume personal responsibility (idiom); to take charge of a section
to play a leading role/to bear a heavy responsibility
to be popular/to be in luck/to have good luck/to develop smoothly
